project.teaser: WENDY aims at unravelling the factors triggering social acceptance of wind farms through an in-depth analysis at three dimensions: social sciences and humanities, environmental sciences and technological engineering.For that, the project will implement a series of local...
project.objective: WENDY aims at unravelling the factors triggering social acceptance of wind farms through an in-depth analysis at three dimensions: social sciences and humanities, environmental sciences and technological engineering. For that, the project will implement a series of local actions promoting the wider adoption of the project solutions, including guidelines, reports and handbooks which will be created to boost the understanding of wind farms decision making processes and enhance energy citizenship. This will be supported by the spatial multi-criteria WENDY toolbox. A tool able to identify the optimal turbines’ siting with the minimum environmental impact and highest social acceptance likelihood. All developed models, methods, guidelines and tools will be implemented within 10 wind projects spread across 4 countries. These have been selected considering: geography (north vs. south Europe), maturity stage (viability phase / planning phase / short-term operation phase / long-term operation phase); type of wind energy (onshore / offshore – floating, fixed-); and co-existence with other activities (agriculture, fisheries, energy communities). In these locations, outreach activities tailored to their specificities will be performed, creating the WENDY Knowledge Hubs which will incorporate citizens, local authorities, business owners and value chain actors of wind energy. WENDY Hubs will serve as a baseline for the WENDY Knowledge Exchange Platform, a forum that will be developed to facilitate the exchange of knowledge between decision makers and key stakeholders within wind farms planning processes. For a successful implementation of the project activities, all the value chain and the best-in-class expertise is involved in the project consortium including 9 partners from 6 European countries: 1 Large Company (EGP), 2 SMEs (WR, Q-PLAN), 1 University (CBS), 2 RTO (CIRCE, NINA), 1 Energy Community (MEC), 2 Non-profit organisations and associations (NOWC, APPA).
project.title: Multicriteria analysis of the technical, environmental and social factors triggering the PIMBY principle for Wind technologies
project.keywords: Wind energy, Energy community, SSH, Wind technology, Biodiversity, Modeling tools, Knowledge Hubs, Guidelines, Models, Energy Citizenship, Enviromental design, Energy landscape, Onshore, Offshore

result.title: Consenting process and community development schemes
result.description: Descriptive document with the countries participating in the use cases and comparison with the European directives

result.title: Impact assessment of the implemented methods and optimization of the WENDY toolbox
result.description: Summary of lessons learnt and holistic impact assessment evaluation, together a policy brief on operationalization of energy stewardship thinking.

result.title: Recommendations and good practices on the authorisation processes
result.description: Analytical report with recommendations and good practices on the authorisation processes and community development schemes at the WENDY use cases

result.title: Mid-term report on E&C&D activities
result.description: Report on the progress of the E&C&D activities during the project (M24)

result.title: WENDY Key Performance Indicators
result.description: List of KPIs that will be used to keep the project performance from the technical, environmental and social perspective and that will feed the WENDY toolbox

result.title: WENDY Knowledge Exchange Platform (1st version)
result.description: Functionalities of the WENDY KEP for the exchange of information among citizens, local authorities, regulators and wind farm developers: on-going report (M18)

result.title: Validated models on integrated ES-LCA benefits on biodiversity
result.description: Mapping of WENDY ecosystem benefits based on dialogues with key stakeholders at the selected use cases and analysis of environmental impact in carbon footprint including mitigation solutions and compensation strategies.

result.title: WENDY behavioural interventions
result.description: Applied methodology in the use cases and behavioural experiments performed.

result.title: Exploitation of synergies with relevant projects (Updated)
result.description: Update of D7.3

result.title: Energy landscape and environmental design at WENDY use cases
result.description: Report on results gathering and mitigation solutions for environmental design (avifauna detection system, curtailment evaluation and wind characterization for micro siting) and inputs collected from energy landscape analysis at the use cases to validate the effect of the implemented models (ES mapping and LCA)

result.title: Stakeholders’ perceptions, awareness levels and willingness to accept and participate in wind farms
result.description: Fine-tune of the WENDY use cases conditions and stakeholders’ perceptions and concerns based on social acceptance assessment survey and consultation interviews.

result.title: Communication and dissemination plan (2nd update)
result.description: Second update of D7.1

result.title: IPR agreements and Exploitation and Sustainability Plan (Updated)
result.description: Update of D7.2

result.title: WENDY social acceptance interventions framework
result.description: Methodology including the behavioural and psychological interventions to increase the social acceptance of wind energy projects based on insights from D2.1-D2.4 (reported at M12 and updated at M24)

category.title: Report Summary

result.title: Communication and dissemination plan (1st update)
result.description: Update of D7.1

result.title: WENDY societal engagement and capacity building program
result.description: Summary of the engagement strategy and capacity building actions

result.title: RRI First report and Progress Report (revised)
result.description: Update of D1.3

result.title: Communication and dissemination plan
result.description: 1) dissemination methods and channels and their associated; activities and tools to reach the expected impacts; 2) dissemination procedures; 3) the DEC activities’ schedule and complementarities among partners; and 4) a preliminary definition of the exploitation strategy and pathways.

result.title: WENDY social acceptance interventions framework (Updated)
result.description: Update of D4.1

result.title: Challenges and needs for increasing social acceptance and enhancing participation in wind energy projects
result.description: Overall summary of consolidated findings in DLV 2.1-2.3 reporting: (a) definition of regional challenges, (b) definition of needs and (c) preliminary identification of intervention areas.

result.title: Lighthouse wind farms across Europe: impact and best practices
result.description: Report on the main challenges and key aspects identified towards wind energy based on a study of more than 40 wind farms across Europe

result.title: Holistic assessment of wind Energy Stewardship at WENDY use cases
result.description: Methodology applied at the use cases for (i) implementation of the tools at wind farms in planning/evaluation phase, (ii) collection of data to feed the ‘retrospective module’ on WENDY toolbox

result.title: Handbook on environmental design solutions
result.description: This Handbook will evaluate the TRL maturity of each system, its focal target species and environment, effectiveness and costs and logistics of implementation. Finally, it will gather the most promising solutions for environmental risks based on the diagnosis of environmental impacts caused by wind energy.

result.title: Single multi-variable KPI
result.description: Report summarising the methodology to obtain the single multi-variable indicator by using the inputs from the WENDY toolbox, that is fed with the KPIs defined in D3.5.

result.title: Co-definition of the WENDY turbines-communities co-existence roadmaps
result.description: Detail of the co-creation workshops’ results and co-designed roadmaps.

result.title: WENDY Knowledge Exchange Platform (2nd version)
result.description: Functionalities of the WENDY KEP for the exchange of information among citizens, local authorities, regulators and wind farm developers: final KEP operative (M36)

result.title: Exploitation of synergies with relevant projects
result.description: Report with the results obtained from the collaboration and synergies with other EU funded projects and platforms

result.title: Regional and EU framework conditions affecting turbines’ social acceptance
result.description: Detailed analysis of the regulatory conditions and framework settings at both EU level and WENDY use cases level through i interviews with key stakeholders and ii findings from quantitative databases and previous projects

result.title: Guidelines to enhance wind energy citizenship and policy recommendations for turbines-communities harmonious co-existence
result.description: Guidelines and policy recommendations analysing gaps, shortcomings, policies and comparisons across the countries studied, to identify key similarities and differences, and prospects for future correct implementation

result.title: RRI First report and Progress Report
result.description: This deliverable will contain an overview of the innovations planned within the project and will define the innovation management process, including Responsible Research and Innovation (RRI) practices.

category.title: wind energy

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
